body_html:
This would lead to rather strange behavior if your values are float -- since you now depend on the content of the vector to be compared.

I think this needs to be fixed with a cast, or if this blocks something downstream (e.g. the contrib.metrics issue linked above), then the code that performs type checking which is too strict should be made more tolerant.

This change as is is probably too dangerous.

This would lead to rather strange behavior if your values are float -- since you now depend on the content of the vector to be compared.
I think this needs to be fixed with a cast, or if this blocks something downstream (e.g. the contrib.metrics issue linked above), then the code that performs type checking which is too strict should be made more tolerant.
This change as is is probably too dangerous.
body:
This would lead to rather strange behavior if your values are float -- since you now depend on the content of the vector to be compared. 

I think this needs to be fixed with a cast, or if this blocks something downstream (e.g. the contrib.metrics issue linked above), then the code that performs type checking which is too strict should be made more tolerant.

This change as is is probably too dangerous.
